name: St. Nicodemus

locations.description: Pharisee and member of the Sanhedrin in Jerusalem

summary: Nicodemus was a Pharisee and member of the Sanhedrin who came to Jesus by night to learn from him. Jesus explained to him the necessity of being 'born again' through water and the Spirit. Nicodemus later defended Jesus before the Sanhedrin and, together with Joseph of Arimathea, prepared Jesus' body for burial with a mixture of myrrh and aloes. He is venerated as a saint in both Eastern and Western traditions.
keyQuotes: How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother's womb and be born?
